abstract: Oracle said Thursday it would buy Hyperion Solutions, which makes software that allows corporations to analyze and track their performance, for $3.3 billion in cash. The deal would be the latest trophy in a lengthy string of acquisitions for the database software giant, which has been struggling to grow from within.
lead_paragraph: Oracle said Thursday it would buy Hyperion Solutions, which makes software that allows corporations to analyze and track their performance, for $3.3 billion in cash. The deal would be the latest trophy in a lengthy string of acquisitions for the database software giant, which has been struggling to grow from within.

headline.main: Oracle to Buy Hyperion for $3.3 Billion
